message_history.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: Please track and compile the average monthly house prices for England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland, for the period from January 2022 to April 2025 (including January 2022 and April 2025). Please cite all the statistics from government websites.

Please output the compiled data in one Markdown table format. The column names in the table should be, in order: Month, House Price in England (Pounds), House Price in Wales (Pounds), House Price in Scotland (Pounds), House Price in Northern Ireland (Pounds)
For the column 'Month', list the month in the format 2022/01, 2022/02.

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```?

<think>
To start, I need to gather the average monthly house prices for each of the four regions of the UK over the specified period. Since I don't have direct access to government databases or APIs, I'll need to perform an initial search.
</think>

<search>average monthly house prices England Scotland Wales Northern Ireland from January 2022 to April 2025</search>

Search query: average monthly house prices England Scotland Wales Northern Ireland from January 2022 to April 2025
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/bulletins/privaterentandhousepricesuk/december2025):
Private rent and house prices, UK: December 2025 Average house prices increased to £292,000 (1.4%) in England, £211,000 (1.5%) in Wales, and £192,000 (3.3%) in Scotland, in the 12 months to ...

[Doc 2](https://www.gov.uk/government/news/uk-house-price-index-for-january-2025):
UK House Price Index for January 2025 - GOV.UK In England the January data shows, on average, house prices rose by 0.2% since December 2024. The annual price rise of 4.8% takes the average ...

[Doc 3](https://landregistry.data.gov.uk/app/ukhpi/):
UK House Price Index - Land Registry As of October 2025, the average house price in the UK is £269,862, and the index stands at 103.4. Property prices have fallen by 0.1% compared to the ...

This search has provided relevant data but not enough granular details per month from January 2022 to April 2025 for all regions. Given the iterative nature of such searches and the lack of direct historical monthly data across all regions, I would need more specific queries to find precise historical monthly figures.

I will try searching again with a more specific timeframe to ensure capturing the required data:
</think>

<search>average monthly house prices England Scotland Wales Northern Ireland from January 2022 to April 2025 government statistics</search>

Search query: average monthly house prices England Scotland Wales Northern Ireland from January 2022 to April 2025 government statistics
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/uk-house-price-index-reports):
UK House Price Index: reports - GOV.UK Reports for the UK House Price Index (UK HPI) for England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland, including in CSV format.

[Doc 2](https://landregistry.data.gov.uk/app/ukhpi/):
UK House Price Index - Land Registry As of October 2025, the average house price in the UK is £269,862, and the index stands at 103.4. Property prices have fallen by 0.1% compared to the ...

[Doc 3](https://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/bulletins/privaterentandhousepricesuk/december2025):
Private rent and house prices, UK: December 2025 Average house prices increased to £292,000 (1.4%) in England, £211,000 (1.5%) in Wales, and £192,000 (3.3%) in Scotland, in the 12 months to ...

The link to the UK House Price Index (UK HPI) reports seems promising for finding the necessary data. Let's proceed with this direction:

<search>download UK House Price Index CSV England Scotland Wales Northern Ireland from January 2022 to April 2025</search>

Search query: download UK House Price Index CSV England Scotland Wales Northern Ireland from January 2022 to April 2025
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.gov.uk/government/statistical-data-sets/uk-house-price-index-data-downloads-april-2025):
UK House Price Index: data downloads April 2025 UK House Price Index: data downloads April 2025. Download aggregated data behind the UK House Price Index (UK HPI), in CSV format.

[Doc 2](https://landregistry.data.gov.uk/app/ukhpi/):
UK House Price Index If you would like to download all of the UKHPI data in comma-separated (CSV) format, please see the UK House Price Index reports page.

[Doc 3](https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/uk-house-price-index-reports):
UK House Price Index: reports Reports for the UK House Price Index (UK HPI) for England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland, including in CSV format.

Given the specific CSV download option mentioned, I'll now access the data to compile it into the requested format.
</think>

<search>download UK House Price Index CSV for England Scotland Wales Northern Ireland from January 2022 to April 2025</search>

Search query: download UK House Price Index CSV for England Scotland Wales Northern Ireland from January 2022 to April 2025
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.gov.uk/government/statistical-data-sets/uk-house-price-index-data-downloads-april-2025):
UK House Price Index: data downloads April 2025 - GOV.UK UK House Price Index: data downloads April 2025. Download aggregated data behind the UK House Price Index (UK HPI), in CSV format.

[Doc 2](https://landregistry.data.gov.uk/app/ukhpi/):
UK House Price Index - Land Registry If you would like to download all of the UKHPI data in comma-separated (CSV) format, please see the UK House Price Index reports page.

[Doc 3](https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/uk-house-price-index-reports):
UK House Price Index: reports - GOV.UK Reports for the UK House Price Index (UK HPI) for England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland, including in CSV format.
